results.title: Unpacking Filmscapes - The Coloured Sky: New Women II
results.creator_credit: Shelley Matulick, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: Yang Fudong’s five-channel video installation, ‘The Coloured Sky: New Women II’ (2014), marks an aesthetic departure from his signature output on 35mm black and white film to vivid colour.

results.title: Unmarried mothers
results.creator_credit: Michael Grigsby, Elaine Grand and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description: A report on illegitimacy in Britain. Eight unmarried mothers are interviewed before and after the birth of their babies. They talk about contraception, abortion, adoption and the problems they face in society and in supporting a baby. The work of the National Council of the Unmarried Mother and Child, Mothers and Baby Homes and the social worker is shown. Narrated by Douglas Keay.

results.title: UNmarked
results.brief_description:
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2004.
In a cruel world where perfection is paramount, where do the less than perfect stand? Winner of the ACMI prize for best student animation 2004.

results.title: Unknown pleasures = Ren Xiao yao [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jia Zhang-ke, Li Kit-ming, Shozo Ichiyama, Radiant Advertising Company, Bitters End (Unknown pleasures)--Beijing Film Academy, Hu Tong Communications, T-Mark, E-Pictures, Lumen Films and Office Kitano
results.brief_description: Unknown pleasures: Set in the provincial Chinese city of Datong in 2001, the story follows the lives of two 19 year-old unemployed and disenchanted friends Bin Bin (Zhao Wei Wei) and Xiao Ji (Wu Qiong) who spend their days aimlessly wandering around dreaming of ways of escaping their meaningless and boring existences. China, with its rapidly changing political and economical role in the world, finds itself being drawn into the web of globalisation and the World Trade Organisation and televisions all over China are blasting out the message of change to the Chinese population. However, for the alienated Bin Bin and Xiao Ji, it is the day-to-day survival that counts. Poignant and slow-moving. Cast also includes Zhao Tao, Zhou Qing Feng. “Xiao Wu”: Jia Zhang-Ke’s directorial debut low-budget film shot on 16mm with non-professional actors about a small time thief and pickpocket, Xiao Wu, operating in a small provincial town at a time of immense social change in China. Xiao Wu finds it difficult to adapt to the new China and worse still, that he is becoming an outcast facing rejection from a potential relationship and even his own parents. A tragi-comedy. Cast includes Wang Hong Wei, Hao Hong Jian, Zuo Bai Tao, Ma Jin Rei, Liu Jun Ying. Director of photography for both these beautifully directed films is Yu Lik Wai.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jia Zhang-ke, Li Kit-ming, Shozo Ichiyama, Radiant Advertising Company, Bitters End (Unknown pleasures)—Beijing Film Academy, Hu Tong Communications, T-Mark, E-Pictures, Lumen Films and Office Kitano

results.title: Unknown Island
results.brief_description:
Two Pacific explorers go sailing and encounter an unknown island. When they meet the tribal people and do not understand them, they procure a piece of land and build a dwelling.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Unknown Chaplin
results.creator_credit: David Gill, Kevin Brownlow and Thames Television
results.brief_description: A three part series which both surveys and throws new light on Chaplin’s career in films. The first part, My Happiest Years, covers his work in 2 reel comedies. The second part, The Great Dictator, covers his early years as the independent producer of The Kid and The Gold Rush. The third part, Hidden Treasures, includes previously unseen home movies and scenes cut from the release prints of City Lights and Modern Times. Narrated by James Mason.

The third part, Hidden Treasures, includes previously unseen home movies and scenes cut from the release prints of City Lights and Modern Times. Narrated by James Mason.
